oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Distribution of the invasive plant species Heracleum sosnowskyi Manden. in the Komi Republic (Russia)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Chadin, Ivan
Dalke, Igor
Zakhozhiy, Ilya
Malyshev, Ruslan
Madi, Elena
Kuzivanova, Olga
Kirillov, Dmitrii
Elsakov, Vladimir
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: invasion biology
invasive species
Russia
Heracleum sosnowskyi
invasive plant
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Occurrences of the invasive plant species Heracleum sosnowskyi Manden. in the Komi Republic (northeastern part of European Russia) were recorded and published in the Global Biodiversity Information Facility (GBIF http://www.gbif.org) using the RIVR information system (http://ib.komisc.ru/add/rivr/en). RIVR stands for "Rasprostranenie Invasionnyh Vidov Rastenij" [Occurrence of Invasion Plant Species]. This citizen science project aims at collecting occurrence data about invasive plant species with the help of citizen scientists. Information can be added by any user after a simple registration (concept) process. However, the data published in GBIF are provided only by professional scientists. The total study area is approximately 19,000 km2. The GBIF resource contains 10894 Heracleum sosnowskyi occurrence points, each with their geographical coordinates and photographs of the plants in the locus of growth. The preliminary results of species distribution modelling on the territory of European North-East Russia presented.
